comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started an entry for him in Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Frederick_Shrady,_Jr. George Frederick Shrady, Jr. (?-1933) George F. Shrady, Ex-coroner, Dies. Son Of Eminent Physician Caused Lowering Of Death Rate From 'the Bends.' Headed Aqueduct Police ... Sanitary Engineer. His Profession Once Had Charge Of Tammany Speakers' Bureau. Source: New York Times; April 6, 1933 George Frederick Shrady, Sr. (1837-1907) was his father

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Letter from George F. Shrady, head of the Board of Water Supply Police (AKA the Aqueduct Police), supports establishment of a permanent county constabulary for Westchester County, New York -- but opposes a New York State Police force -- New York Times, January 1, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9B04E2DB1F3BE6... (The great Aqueduct, which brought water to New York City, was under construction at this time.) "Aqueduct Police Praised," New York Times, February 28,1916: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9D03E...
